DataElement.preferredName: Person Malignant Neoplasm Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response for questions addressing cancer and treatments for cancer, as outlined in the clinical trial protocol, to determine a person's elgibility to participate in the clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Malignant Neoplasm Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/25/16 tt, released. 2/24/16 tt, curated for Theradex.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient had a second canc
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a second cancer within the past 5 years or a cancer undergoing any treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has Ph+ Pre-B cell ALL OR Ph+ MPAL, has patient been refractory to or intolerant of treatment with at least 2 second-generation or third-generation tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has Ph+ Pre-B cell ALL OR Ph+ MPAL, has patient been refractory to or intolerant of treatment with at least 1 second-generation or third-generation tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known malignant central nervous system (CNS) disease other than neurologically stable, treated brain metastases Â– defined as metastasis having no evidence of progression or hemorrhage for at least 2 weeks after treatment and off any systemic corticosteroids for the treatment of brain metastases for at least 14 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have locally advanced or metastatic disease progression during or following (within 12 months) platinum-based chemotherapy (cisplatin or carboplatin) (ARM A) OR cisplatin ineligible as defined in the protocol (ARM B)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient being evaluated for cancer OR treated for cancer OR enrolled in a clinical trial for cancer at your clinical site?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has indolent lymphoma, has patient undergone 3 or more prior regimens of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has breast cancer and is eligible for a PARP inhibitor by FDA approvals, has patient received prior PARP inhibitor, as per FDA indication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a concomitant malignancy requiring active systemic therapy, excluding adjuvant endocrine therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prior or concurrent malignancy requiring active therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a prior history of another malignancy, was any prior chemotherapy or radiation administered within 6 weeks prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have locally advanced or metastatic disease progression during or following (within 12 months) platinum-based chemotherapy (cisplatin or carboplatin) (ARM A) OR Platinum ineligible status as defined in section 3.1.2 (ARM B)?

DataElement.changeDescription: 2/25/16 tt, approved by ZP; released. 2/24/16 tt, curated for Theradex.
